docs.title: Features
docs.text:
Below are the main features of the integration

  • Keep track and set your holiday mode
  • See when your next subscription is due
  • See how much will be delivered as part of your subscription

docs.title: How to install
docs.text: There are multiple ways of installing the integration. Once you've installed the integration, you'll need to setup your account before you can use the integration.

docs.title: HACS
docs.text:
This integration can be installed directly via HACS. To install:

  • Add the repository to your HACS installation
  • Click Download

docs.title: Manual
docs.text:
You should take the latest published release. The current state of develop will be in flux and therefore possibly subject to change.

To install, place the contents of custom_components into the <config directory>/custom_components folder of your Home Assistant installation. Once installed, don't forget to restart your home assistant instance for the integration to be picked up.

docs.title: How to setup
docs.text: Please follow the setup guide to setup your initial account. This guide details the configuration, along with the entities that will be available to you.

docs.title: Entities
docs.text: This integration includes several entities. Please see entities for more information.

docs.title: Services
docs.text: This integration includes several services. Please review them in the services doc.

docs.title: Blueprints
docs.text: Blueprints are an excellent way to get you up and running with the integration quickly. They can also be used as a guide for setting up new automations which you can tailor to your needs.

docs.title: Delay Subscription Order
docs.text:
Install blueprint | Source

This blueprint will automatically delay the next order for a Smol subscription when stock levels are too high.

docs.title: Start Holiday
docs.text:
Install blueprint | Source

This blueprint automatically starts a Smol accounts holiday mode when a calendar entry starts.

docs.title: Entities
docs.text: The following entities are available with each configured account

docs.title: Is On Holiday
docs.text:
binary_sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_is_on_holiday

Binary sensor to determine if your account is currently in holiday mode

docs.title: Holiday End Date
docs.text:
sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_holiday_end_date

Sensor to determine the end date of your holiday for your account

docs.title: Subscription Quantity
docs.text:
sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_{{PRODUCT_ID}}_subscription_quantity

Sensor indicating the quantity of items that are present in each delivery of your subscription. For example, this might return 30 if you are subscribed to 30 dishwasher tablets.

docs.title: Subscription Next Charge
docs.text:
sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_{{PRODUCT_ID}}_subscription_next_charge

Sensor indicating the next time the subscription will be charged. When this changes and you're not in holiday mode, it's a good indication that a subscription has been sent.

This can be changed using the change next charge date service.

docs.title: How often is data refreshed?
docs.text: Data is refreshed every 6 hours.

docs.title: Do you support older versions of the integration?
docs.text: Due to time constraints, I will only ever support the latest version of the integration. If you have an issue with an older version of the integration, my initial answer will always be to update to the latest version. This might be different to what HACS is reporting if you are not on the minimum supported Home Assistant version (which is highlighted in each release's changelog).

docs.title: How do I know when there's an update available?
docs.text:
If you've installed via HACS, and you are on version 2 or above, then updates will be surfaced in the normal update location within Home Assistant. If you are on a version below 2, then you can keep an eye on sensor.hacs to see the number of pending updates. This could be used with an automation or highlighted on your dashboard. This will include any HACS integration update, not just this one.

If you've installed the integration manually, then you should keep an eye on the GitHub releases. You could even subscribe to the RSS feed.

docs.title: How do I increase the logs for the integration?
docs.text:
If you are having issues, it would be helpful to include Home Assistant logs as part of any raised issue. This can be done by following the instructions outlined by Home Assistant.

You should run these logs for about a day and then include the contents in the issue. Please be sure to remove any personal identifiable information from the logs before including them.

docs.title: Services
docs.text: There are a few services available within this integration, which are detailed here.

docs.title: smol.start_holiday_mode
docs.text:
Puts a Smol account into holiday mode.

Attribute Optional Description target.entity_id no The name of the holiday sensor (i.e. binary_sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_is_on_holiday) that represents the account to put into holiday mode. data.end_date_time no The datetime for when your holiday should end.

docs.title: smol.end_holiday_mode
docs.text:
Takes a Smol account out of holiday mode

Attribute Optional Description target.entity_id no The name of the holiday sensor (i.e. binary_sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_is_on_holiday) that represents the account to put into holiday mode.

docs.title: smol.change_next_charge_date
docs.text:
Changes the next charge date for a Smol subscription

Attribute Optional Description target.entity_id no The name of the holiday sensor (i.e. sensor.smol_{{ACCOUNT_NAME}}_{{PRODUCT_ID}}_subscription_next_charge) that represents the account to put into holiday mode. data.next_charge_date no The next charge date to change the subscription to.

docs.title: Sponsorship
docs.text: If you are enjoying the integration, why not use my referral link if you're not already a part of Smol, or if possible, make a one off or monthly GitHub sponsorship.

docs.title: Account
docs.text: Setup is done entirely via the integration UI.

docs.title: Name
docs.text: This is a name or nickname to help identify the account. This is to support multiple accounts. All associated sensors will have this name in the entity name.

docs.title: Username
docs.text: The username or email address used to access your Smol account.

docs.title: Password
docs.text: The password for your Smol account.
